intro: Velleia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf velleia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a distinctive velvety texture. Velleia macrophylla produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
